title: Am receiving incoming emails but am unable to read them.
content:
After listing incoming emails the following message is displayed: " The account ******.net.au is being processed. Please wait until processing is complete. But it never completes! A steady blue line appears on the right side of the bottom line while on the bottom line on the left is the message 'No emails to download".

Another message encountered: Sending of password for user ******@******..com did not succeed. Mail server mail6.hosting platform.com responded Maximum number of connections from user+lp exceeds (mail.max userip.connections=3)

Finally to close Thunderbird by pressing pressing the "X" in the top right corner doesn't work - have to shut down the computer.

I'm thinking the best solution may be to reinstall Thunderbird provided existing emails will not be lost, and help will be appreciated.

title: Can You Somehow Merge a Sub-Folder from Folder A with a Same-name Sub-Folder in Folder B?
content:
I'm helping my 80 year old father with quite a mess with his email.

He's been using Outlook for about 40 years, and back in 2021, his email service provider, Telus here in Canada, switched their email service over to Google Gmail, and long story short, the switchover from Telus' in-house email service to a Telus-branded Google email service ended up causing a real mess with my Dad's email, due to his main laptop's Outlook desktop application getting switched from IMAP to POP, whereas his Microsoft Surface remained Outlook IMAP, for the past 3.5 years, so they got totally out of sync from each other in some very complicated ways for which there seems no simple fix.

I offer that background just to perhaps explain what I'm about to ask.

In Thunderbird, if there is:

1) a Folder named "Alpha" with a bunch of Sub-Folders

2) a Folder named "Alpha New" with a bunch of Sub-Folders, many of which have the same names of the Sub-Folders within "Alpha" but many of the Sub-Folders having totally different names

and you want to amalgamate the Sub-Folders in the Folder "Alpha" with the Sub-Folders in the Folder "Alpha New,"

and for example you have:

1) a Sub-Folder named "Beta" within the Folder "Alpha"

2) a Sub-Folder named "Beta" within the Folder "Alpha New"

so you to drag "Beta" Sub-Folder from the Folder "Alpha" to the Folder "Alpha New,"

then what will happen?

I ask because in Gmail, it will present a dialogue saying you cannot do that because there is already a Label named "Beta" nested within the Label "Alpha New."

Will Thunderbird give a similar warning, or will it ask if you want to merge the two folders or something?
creator: rob.brownridge

title: po poslední aktualisaci  Thunderbirdu, musím dávat povolení

title: Multiple Profile/instances all working. Now I need to get both on the Win 11 taskbar
content:
I've set up two Thunderbird Profiles. One for all my work emails and one for all my personal ones. I've got two shortcuts on the Desktop setup with the following entries in the target

"C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Thunderbird\thunderbird.exe" -no-remote -P default-release "C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Thunderbird\thunderbird.exe" -no-remote -P PersonalAccounts

They both work well but I'm struggling to work out how to pin the shortcuts to my taskbar so I can just click on either when the need arises.

I did try just setting it up to give me the profile manager "C:\Program Files (x86)\Mozilla Thunderbird\thunderbird.exe" -no-remote -ProfileManager but I'd rather save a click or two if it's possible.

Any ideas on how to do this? It's not letting me pin two Thunderbird shortcuts.

I did try following the Firefox method https://gist.github.com/jooize/5636b9eb975bde30c38b753e9f301de4 but got stuck at the line where it says "select the location field (Ctrl-L).", "Replace text with: about:config" lines.

title: Problem beim Anmelden in meinem E-Mail-Konto
content:
Sehr geehrtes Support-Team,

ich habe ein dringendes Problem mit meinem E-Mail-Konto, das ich über Thunderbird verwalte. Leider kann ich mich seit kurzem nicht mehr anmelden, was besonders problematisch ist, da ich dieses Konto für berufliche Zwecke nutze.

Folgende Probleme sind aufgetreten:

Anmeldung fehlgeschlagen: Bei dem Versuch, mich anzumelden, erhalte ich die Nachricht, dass mein Passwort falsch ist. Leider erinnere ich mich nicht an mein aktuelles Passwort und konnte es auch nicht zurücksetzen.

Kontoerkennung: Obwohl mein Benutzername korrekt erkannt wird, führt dies nicht zur Lösung des Problems, da die Passworteingabe weiterhin scheitert.

Ich habe bereits folgende Schritte unternommen, um das Problem zu beheben:

Überprüfung der Internetverbindung Überprüfung der Kontoeinstellungen in Thunderbird Versuch, das Passwort zurückzusetzen Leider waren diese Maßnahmen nicht erfolgreich. Da ich dringend Zugriff auf mein E-Mail-Konto benötige, wäre ich Ihnen sehr dankbar, wenn Sie mir schnellstmöglich helfen könnten, das Problem zu lösen.

Bitte lassen Sie mich wissen, welche Informationen Sie von mir benötigen oder welche weiteren Schritte ich unternehmen kann.

Mit freundlichen Grüßen, Alaa Nasser

email: alaa.nasser@hornecker.de tel: 017684757394
creator: alaamokhlesnasser

title: Text not wrapping to window when writing emails
content:
Having just installed the new update 128.0.1esr on two different computers running on Windows 10, we have the new problem that when composing new emails the text does not wrap to the window.

Changing the message format (Automatic, plain, HTML) does not make any difference.

Changing the wrap length to 0 in the Config editor does not make any difference either.

This is actually a real nuisance of a problem and we'd be very grateful for help. I suspect this is a bug in the new update but in until it gets sorted out we basically are going to go mad trying to write our emails. Is it possible to revert to the earlier version of Thunderbird, and if so, how?

Many thanks for any suggestions.

title: How can Thunderbird 128 display the subject line with different font colors based on tags?
content:
Hi

In Thunderbird version 128, the table view displays the subject line with different font colors based on tags, as shown in the example below.

https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2024-07-30-07-16-08-b0bfa9.png

I’ve seen at Thunderbird's release notes that Thunderbird supports displaying different font colors based on tags in the card view, as shown in the example below.

https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2024-07-30-07-28-44-d4881a.png

However, in my card view, the subject is displayed in white font, and only the tag label is highlighted, as shown in the example below.

https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2024-07-30-07-20-48-f841b4.png

I would like to know if the card view in 128.0.1esr (64-bit) on Windows 11 has the capability to display the subject line with different font colors based on tags. If it does, could you please advise on how to configure it?
creator: charlee.ch
